greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table T(n,k) = k^n - n^k, n, k > 0, read by descending antidiagonals.
link: Boris Putievskiy, Rows n = 1..76 of triangle, flattened
formula: As a linear array, the sequence is a(n) = A004736(n)^A002260(n) - A002260(n)^A004736(n) or
example: The table T(n,k) (with rows n >= 1 and columns k >= 1) begins as follows:
The start of the sequence as a triangular array, read by rows (i.e., descending antidiagonals of T(n,k)), is as follows:
In the above triangle, row number m contains m numbers: m^1 - 1^m, (m-1)^2 - 2^(m-1), ..., 1^m - m^1.
program: (PARI) matrix(9, 9, n, k, k^n - n^k) \\ _Michel Marcus_, Oct 04 2019
results.author: _Boris Putievskiy_, Dec 14 2012
